coverage: Zephaniah proclaims the near and comprehensive Day of the LORD against Judah and the nations, exposing syncretism, injustice, and complacency, yet promising a purified remnant, universal worship with purified lips, and God himself rejoicing over Zion. Set in Josiah’s era, the book moves from universal judgment to national oracles to a climactic renewal where fear and shame are removed.
id_scheme: Cross-book stable by (type+primary-slug) + deterministic hash; alias reuse for shared entities.

entries: King of Israel, the LORD in your midst
Purified lips → worship shoulder to shoulder

entries.name: Zephaniah son of Cushi
entries.note: Four-generation genealogy may imply royal lineage (Hezekiah), though debated.
entries.blurb: Prophet whose name likely means “YHWH has hidden/protected,” resonating with 2:3’s hope of being hidden in the Day. Ministers in the days of Josiah with a message of judgment-purification-restoration.

entries.name: Josiah king of Judah (context)
entries.blurb: Reform-era monarch providing historical frame. Zephaniah’s indictments may precede or accompany Josiah’s centralizing reforms.

entries.name: Priests
entries.blurb: Priestly establishment implicated in syncretism and compromise.

entries.name: Officials
entries.blurb: Royal officials whose conduct reflects cultural assimilation (foreign apparel) and injustice.

entries.name: Judges
entries.blurb: Predatory officials—wolves at evening who leave nothing for the morning.

entries.name: Prophets (Jerusalem)
entries.blurb: Reckless and treacherous; Zephaniah indicts prophetic malpractice alongside priests.

entries.name: Merchants/Traders
entries.blurb: Maktesh market class lamenting cutoffs; economy cannot shield from the Day.

entries.name: Householders on rooftops
entries.blurb: Practitioners of astral worship; a snapshot of syncretistic piety.

entries.name: Gate/Watch personnel
entries.blurb: Civic guardians associated with city sectors named in judgment oracles.

entries.name: Judah
entries.blurb: Covenant people called to seek humility before the Day; subject to purifying judgment.

entries.name: Jerusalem
entries.blurb: City of corruption and eventual renewal; site of leadership failure and divine rejoicing.

entries.name: Remnant (humble and lowly)
entries.blurb: A purified community characterized by humility and honesty; they find refuge in the LORD.

entries.name: Nations
entries.blurb: Scope of the Day extends to all peoples; end-vision is universal worship with purified lips.

entries.name: Philistines
entries.blurb: Coastal peoples judged; their land becomes pasture for the remnant.

entries.name: Gaza
entries.blurb: Philistine city facing abandonment in the Day.

entries.name: Ashkelon
entries.blurb: Destined for desolation and later sheepfolds for the remnant.

entries.name: Ashdod
entries.blurb: Philistine city struck at noon—symbol of suddenness.

entries.name: Ekron
entries.blurb: Uprooted in the Day; completes the four-city Philistine list.

entries.name: Moab
entries.blurb: Judged for pride and insults against Judah; becomes like Sodom’s wasteland.

entries.name: Ammon
entries.blurb: Judged alongside Moab; incur reproach and become a desolation.

entries.name: Cush (Ethiopia)
entries.blurb: Brief oracle asserting global reach: even distant Cush will be slain by the LORD’s sword.

entries.name: Assyria
entries.blurb: Once-dominant power humbled; Nineveh becomes a haunt for animals.

entries.name: Nineveh
entries.blurb: Boasting city reduced to ruins; animals lodge in her thresholds.

entries.name: Proud/Arrogant
entries.blurb: The haughty removed from Zion; pride is antithetical to remnant identity.

entries.name: Humble/Meek
entries.blurb: Those who seek the LORD and practice righteousness; core of the renewed community.

entries.name: Peoples with purified lips
entries.blurb: Nations transformed to call upon the LORD with one accord—Babel reversed.

entries.name: YHWH (the LORD)
entries.blurb: Divine King who searches Jerusalem with lamps, hosts a sacrificial feast of judgment, removes judgments, and rejoices over Zion with singing.

entries.name: King of Israel, the LORD in your midst
entries.blurb: Title highlighting immanent kingship: God present as warrior-savior who quiets with love and exults over Zion in song.

entries.name: Superscription
entries.blurb: Names the prophet, genealogy, and Josian context—signals authority and possible royal descent.

entries.name: Universal judgment oracle
entries.blurb: Sweeping decree against humans, beasts, birds, and fish—creation-scale purgation reminiscent of flood language.

entries.name: Jerusalem’s woe/indictment
entries.blurb: Woe to the rebellious city: officials, judges, prophets, and priests corrupt; the just LORD within remains faithful.

entries.name: Call to seek humility
entries.blurb: Summons to gather, seek the LORD, righteousness, and humility—‘perhaps you may be hidden’ in the Day.

entries.name: Day of the LORD
entries.blurb: Near and comprehensive judgment that purifies a people for universal worship.

entries.name: Near/at hand Day
entries.blurb: Immediacy rhetoric pressing repentance and watchfulness.

entries.name: Search with lamps
entries.blurb: Forensic image of God inspecting complacent hearts in Jerusalem.

entries.name: Bitter Day
entries.blurb: A day bitter even for the warrior; dread saturates the horizon.

entries.name: Day of wrath
entries.blurb: Judicial anger applied to systemic evil; core Day epithet.

entries.name: Distress & anguish
entries.blurb: Human experience under the Day; psychological and social breakdown.

entries.name: Trumpet & battle cry
entries.blurb: Siege imagery framing the Day as a city’s fall before the Divine King.

entries.name: Darkness & gloom
entries.blurb: Cosmic portents echoing Day language across the prophets.

entries.name: Clouds & thick darkness
entries.blurb: Sinai-theophany textures transposed into judgment scene.

entries.name: Daughter Zion
entries.blurb: Summoned to sing; fear removed as God dwells within.

entries.name: Daughter Jerusalem
entries.blurb: Parallel personification emphasizing communal joy.

entries.name: Pride of Moab/Ammon
entries.blurb: Boast and insult against Judah answered by desolation and reversal.

entries.name: Boasting city (Nineveh)
entries.blurb: City that says ‘I am, and there is none besides me’—hubris meets desertion.

entries.name: Purified speech/lips
entries.blurb: Nations given a common tongue of worship—Babel reversed into doxology.

entries.name: Shame removed
entries.blurb: Removal of proud and shame from Zion; moral cleansing precedes joy.

entries.name: Rejoicing/singing God
entries.blurb: Unique portrait of God exulting over his people with singing.

entries.name: Fear removed
entries.blurb: No more fear in Zion; divine presence secures peace.

entries.name: Judgments removed
entries.blurb: The verdict against Zion lifted; enemies turned back.

entries.name: Gathering the lame
entries.blurb: The marginalized restored and assembled into honor.

entries.name: Gathering the outcast
entries.blurb: Exiles and outcasts brought home to praise and renown.

entries.name: Name & praise among nations
entries.blurb: Zion’s reputation reversed; global recognition of God’s saving work.

entries.name: Reversal of shame/honor
entries.blurb: Cultural reversal central to restoration: disgrace becomes fame.

entries.name: Babel reversal (purified lips)
entries.blurb: Undoing of Babel’s dispersion in a worship-unified humanity.

entries.name: Zion
entries.blurb: Liturgical center of rejoicing; locus of divine presence.

entries.name: Jerusalem
entries.blurb: From corrupt city to singing city—site of transformation.

entries.name: Temple
entries.blurb: Implicit in cultic critique; site of syncretism and intended purity.

entries.name: Maktesh (market district)
entries.blurb: Commercial quarter whose merchants wail at economic collapse.

entries.name: Fish Gate
entries.blurb: City sector signaling localized judgment imagery.

entries.name: Second Quarter
entries.blurb: Residential/administrative district named in the sweep of judgment.

entries.name: Rooftops
entries.blurb: Elevated locations for astral rites; emblem of domestic syncretism.

entries.name: Thresholds
entries.blurb: Philistine ritual echo; leaping over thresholds marks foreign practice.

entries.name: Foreign apparel
entries.blurb: Dress as sign of cultural/religious assimilation among officials.

entries.name: Baal
entries.blurb: Canaanite deity whose cult contaminated Judah’s worship.

entries.name: Milcom
entries.blurb: Ammonite god; oath-taking to Milcom alongside YHWH typifies syncretism.

entries.name: Idols
entries.blurb: Generic reference to graven images; targets of purification.

entries.name: Host of heaven (astro-worship)
entries.blurb: Worship of sun, moon, and stars on rooftops; condemned practice.

entries.name: Silver & gold (cannot deliver)
entries.blurb: Wealth is powerless to avert the Day’s wrath.

entries.name: Sacrifice/banquet of the LORD
entries.blurb: Irony: the LORD prepares a sacrificial feast where the guests are those judged.

entries.name: Blood poured out/dust-like flesh
entries.blurb: Graphic portrayal of the Day’s carnage and mortality.

entries.name: Complacent on their dregs
entries.blurb: Wine metaphor for settled indifference—‘the LORD will not do good, nor will he do ill.’

entries.name: Merchants cut off
entries.blurb: Commercial elites eliminated; false security exposed.

entries.name: Pasturelands for shepherds
entries.blurb: Philistine coast becomes grazing land for the remnant—a peace economy.

entries.name: Nineveh desolation fauna
entries.blurb: Herds, wild beasts, owl/pelican at thresholds—architectural capitals become perches.

entries.name: Purified lips → worship shoulder to shoulder
entries.blurb: Unified service by the peoples; international liturgy.

entries.name: Song over Zion
entries.blurb: Divine singing as liturgical-theological climax.

entries.name: Rest in his love
entries.blurb: God quiets you with his love—healing of fear and shame.

entries.name: Gathered exiles
entries.blurb: Diaspora reversal; homecoming under divine favor.

entries.name: Restore fortunes
entries.blurb: Comprehensive reversal of losses under God’s timing.

entries.name: Day of the LORD (canonical trajectory)
entries.blurb: From Amos’s warning to Joel’s apocalyptic textures to Zephaniah’s purification and Malachi’s eschaton—the Day as judgment-unto-renewal.

entries.name: Judgment as purification
entries.blurb: Aim is not mere annihilation but a cleansed people with truthful lips and humble hearts.

entries.name: Remnant theology & humility
entries.blurb: Seek humility; the remnant is characterized by meekness and justice.

entries.name: Universal worship
entries.blurb: Peoples from beyond the rivers of Cush bring offerings; worship becomes transnational.

entries.name: God singing over his people
entries.blurb: Unique biblical image shaping mystical and pastoral traditions.

entries.name: Intertexts and echoes
entries.blurb: Isaiah 24–27; 40–55; Joel 2; Nah 1–3; Hab 2–3; Revelation—web of Day/restoration language.

entries.name: Apocalyptic reception (Revelation)
entries.blurb: Themes of universal judgment and gathered nations resonate in John’s apocalypse.

entries.name: Patristic/mystical reception of Zeph 3:17
entries.blurb: From early fathers to medieval mystics, divine singing becomes a locus of contemplative theology.
